abstractContent.text: This paper describes the AX Semantics' submission to the SIGMORPHON 2019 shared task on morphological reinflection.

entities.text: SIGMORPHON 2019 shared task on morphological reinflection

abstractContent.text: We implemented two systems, both tackling the task for all languages in one codebase, without any underlying language specific features.

The first one is an encoder-decoder model using AllenNLP; the second system uses the same model modified by a custom trainer that trains only with the target language resources after a specific threshold.
We especially focused on building an implementation using AllenNLP with out-of-the-box methods to facilitate easy operation and reuse.

introductionContent.text: This paper describes our implementation and results for Task 1 of the 2019 Shared Task.
The task is to generate inflected word forms given the lemma and a morphological feature specification (.
See for an example in German, where a verb lemma is inflected according to the specified number, mood, tense and person.

sehen (V;IND;PST;3;PL) → sahen In contrast to last year, where the training data was only in the respective target language, this year the given data consists of up to 10000 exemplars of one high resource language combined with up to 100 exemplars of a low resource language.
The target language is the low resource language.
The task is to use the high resource data to improve the inflection of the low resource language.
Including the surprise language pairs the task consists of 99 language pairs.
